llspy.image package¶

Submodules¶

llspy.image.camera module¶

class llspy.image.camera.CameraParameters(fname=None, data=None, roi=[513, 769, 1536, 1280])¶

Bases: object

Class to store parameters for camera correction

Filename: path to tif file that stores the camera correction parameters,
first plane = param A second plane = param B third plane = dark image (offset map) #TODO: fourth plane = variance map
correct_stacks(stacks, dampening=0.88, median=True, target='cpu')¶

interleave stacks and apply correction for “sticky” Flash pixels.

Expects a list of 3D np.ndarrays ordered in order of acquisition:
e.g. [stack_ch0, stack_ch1, stack_ch2, ...]

Returns a corrected list of np.ndarrays of the same shape and length as the input

get_subroi(subroi)¶

Bases: object

class to define camera roi

llspy.image.camera.calc_correction¶
llspy.image.camera.correctInsensitivePixels(stack, backgroundValue, medianRange=3, verbose=False, withMean=False)¶

correct bad pixels on sCMOS camera. based on MATLAB code by Philipp J. Keller, HHMI/Janelia Research Campus, 2011-2014

llspy.image.camera.determineThreshold(array, maxSamples=50000)¶
llspy.image.camera.savetiff(arr, outpath, dx=1, dz=1, dt=1, unit='micron')¶

sample wrapper for tifffile.imsave imagej=True.
